entry.title: Standing Cushion
entry.summary:
[July 2018 - July 2019]
Master Thesis

"How to develop a Device to remind Elderly people do more activities when they sitting for long time in home?" is the research question. This thesis is meant to address these problems by analysing the required infrastructure of an Internet of Things in home, which was developed following concepts of user-centered design and usability. After the analysis, presenting a new assistive system based on Embed Interaction tech for enabling low-cost sensing on everyday objects.

entry.title: Fluency
entry.summary:
[February 2019 - July 2019]
Course: Physical Computing

Fluency is a language learning system aimed at beginners in the classroom. In this intended context, a teacher would guide students through the process of using the system. In terms of the system itself, users are shown a digital scene with a sentence representing a scenario. However, the sentence has a word missing. Users will scan augmented blocks each representing a character in an attempt to build the missing word. If the user builds the correct word than the scene will change to represent the overall sentence and a success message will be displayed. If the user fails to build a word, a generic ‘failure’ scenario will be shown and the user will be prompted to try again. Additionally, if a word is built that makes sense within the sentence but is not the correct word, the user will still be prompted to try again but will also be shown a unique scenario depending on the word. There are two levels of difficulty, the first level allows users to spend as long as they need to build the word whilst the second adds a timer. Before the game starts, the teacher can select the level and word-type and can assist the students in general. Overall the concept is aimed to enhance the language learning experience, making it more effective and engaging.

entry.title: Anxiety Eliminator Game
entry.summary:
[July 2017 - November 2017]
Personal Happy Project

Anxiety Eliminator is an interactive & digital game prototype built by using the Unity and involve some form of physical interaction by using the Leap Motion and MakeyMakey. Players need to match the music and tap the schematic pattern in the game prototype. The player operates the digital game prototype mainly by their gestures activities or by hitting physical objects.

entry.title: BeUpStanding
entry.summary:
[July 2018 - November 2018]
Course: Design Computing Studio 3 - Build

“BeAppStanding” is an iOS mobile application to further help the target users to sit less and stand more. This application and physical prototype were development by using native platforms (Swift,Xcode). The key component of my responsibility is to consider how to enhance the user experience and design the data visualisation by using emotion design and interface usability. In terms of it, the system can improve the cognition of target audience.

entry.title: The Little Prince
entry.summary:
[February 2018 - June 2018]
Course: Introduction to Web Design

The Little Prince is an interactive story website for children aged 13 and under. The project aims to design a digital version of a printed “choose users own adventure” book. The entire website was designed through three iterations process to explore how it can most effectively translate the book from physical to digital form.
